group_1.textLeft: I'm an...Onibaba?

group_1.textRight: That is what Charu said at first, but...
I am the one who believed you were possessed@by an Onibaba...

group_1.textLeft: So those were purification rites―
Abruptly slapping me on the back and other such@odd behavior...?
Plus these prayer beads and talismans...@You've convinced me...
But the only reason you believed me to be an@Onibaba
is because... I was talking to a ghost?

group_1.textRight: In Yusurinbo Shogun something similar happened,
and the chief priest even showed me a scroll of the@Onibaba...
So now that I've put two and two together,
you're really not anything like the Onibaba, are you@Asahi-chan...? I'm really sorry.

group_1.textLeft: No need...so long as you understand, that is what's@most important...
(Then this means my secret hasn't been revealed@after all...?)

group_1.textRight: Hey now, you said you asked about this Onibaba@to the chief priest, didn't ya?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, he said it's a story that's been passed down@in this temple.
Maybe you heard about it too, Ryouko-chan?

group_1.textRight: Nah, I ain't ever heard of it...
I HAVE heard kid's tales real similar to it, though...

group_1.textLeft: ...Could it be that...
[chara:102601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]―?!
That was the chief priest's voice.
Perhaps he was caught by one of my traps in the@garden...

group_1.textRight: Let's go and see!
Well shoot, if he ain't hangin' upside down.

group_1.textLeft: I didn't account for the chief priest being caught.@...I feel incredibly ashamed.

group_1.textCenter: No, I'm the one who oughta be ashamed here...

group_1.textLeft: Let me help you down and then we can talk about@this...
...Eh, you mean it was all a lie?
And after that happened...you really played it up,@didn't you?
Oi oi, chief priest, what gave ya the idea to pull a@fast one like this?

group_1.textRight: There are no words I can return in kind...
The legend of Onibaba itself is true, but the tale@I told to Chiharu
is a tall tale that's gone through many a change@solely to keep children from staying up at night.
Chiharu-chan's reaction was just too good that@I had to have some fun, but...
I knew not such a thunderous uproar would be my@doing.
I was only just running here to see what the@commotion was.
For troubling you, Asahi-chan,@I am deeply ashamed...

group_1.textLeft: So long as the misunderstanding has been resolved,@it's no matter to me.

group_1.textRight: I'm really sorry too...

group_1.textLeft: No, I am too...as I got a little too serious with the@traps.
Letting my hunter's blood get to me like this,@it's inexcusable...

group_1.textRight: Not at all... We're the ones who distrusted you@to begin with.
...I am so sorry.

group_1.textCenter: We have no excuse for what we did...

group_1.textRight: The hell's with the mood here?!

group_1.textLeft: She's right. Our dear chief priest's lie won't be@forgiven, but...

group_1.textRight: Uu...

group_1.textLeft: At least our misunderstanding with each other is@taken care of.

group_1.textRight: Oh, sure has.@How 'bout we go get some grub together.
Just this morning, Chika 'n I got a real good haul@fishing,
so we can all eat outta the same pot!
Well, we already stuffed ourselves full at the@welcome party, but hey, what's another, huh!

group_1.textLeft: That's a wonderful idea.
Then as my apology, I shall treat everyone to some@wild game cooking.

group_1.textRight: I will treat you all to something as repentance for@my actions as well...

group_1.textLeft: There's no need; I am already over it...

group_1.textRight: Then...juice and sweets!

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Charu...
